---
title: 'Form Rendering Best Practices'
description: 'Guidelines for consistent form rendering in Django templates'
---

## Required Field Indicators

### Overview
We've standardized the approach for marking required form fields across all admin templates.

### Implementation Details
- Red asterisk (\*) added to required field labels
- Consistent markup: `{{ field.label }}{% if field.field.required %} <span style="color: red;">*</span>{% endif %}`
- Follows accessibility guidelines by visually indicating mandatory fields
- Applied across multiple admin templates including:
  - Category Create/Update
  - Sub-Category Create/Update
  - Product Create/Edit

### Code Example
```django
<div class="form-group">
    <label>
        {{ field.label }}
        {% if field.field.required %}
            <span style="color: red;">*</span>
        {% endif %}
    </label>
    <!-- Input field here -->
</div>
```

### Best Practices
- Always use `field.field.required` to determine if a field is mandatory
- Maintain consistent styling for the asterisk
- Ensure color contrast meets accessibility standards

### Motivation
Improves user experience by clearly indicating which form fields are required, reducing potential user confusion during form submission.
